recentPerformance.cushion: Elite goal-line QB with Tush Push package

keyFactors.title: Signature Tush Push Package
keyFactors.description: Hurts' QB sneak (Tush Push) was NFL's most effective short-yardage play, converting at 94% success rate. Nearly automatic inside the 2-yard line.

keyFactors.title: Plus-Money Value
keyFactors.description: At +100 odds, getting even money on QB with 5 rushing TDs and elite goal-line usage provided theoretical edge.

keyFactors.title: Red Zone Opportunities Expected
keyFactors.description: Eagles ranked 3rd in red zone efficiency. Expected multiple goal-line situations in Monday Night Football matchup.

riskFactors: For QB anytime TD props, only rushing TDs count (passing TDs don't qualify)
Defensive game script could limit total offensive TDs
Packers' run defense ranked 12th (4.1 YPC allowed)

quarterBreakdown.description: Hurts fumbled on designed run - rare turnover made OC Kellen Moore more conservative with QB runs. Eagles 0 points in scoreless first quarter.
Scoreless through halftime (0-0). Hurts' first-quarter fumble limited designed QB run calls. No goal-line opportunities materialized.
Jake Elliott FG gave Eagles 3-0 lead but no TDs. Offensive struggles continued - just 3 points through three quarters.
DeVonta Smith 36-yard TD catch (passing TD, doesn't count for QB anytime TD prop) gave Eagles 10-0 lead. Big play rather than goal-line drive - no Tush Push opportunities.

gameResults.whenMissed: Never scored rushing TD - 0 rushing TDs on 5 carries
gameResults.gamePace: Historically low-scoring game (10-7 final). Eagles scored just 10 points total - one FG, one passing TD to Smith. Never got multiple goal-line situations for Tush Push package.

whatWentWrong.title: Only One Offensive TD Scored
whatWentWrong.description: Eagles scored just 10 points (1 FG, 1 passing TD). The extreme defensive nature created limited scoring opportunities - no room for QB rushing TDs.

whatWentWrong.title: Big Play TD, Not Goal-Line Drive
whatWentWrong.description: Philadelphia's only TD came on DeVonta Smith's 36-yard reception - a big play rather than sustained red zone drive requiring Tush Push. No short-yardage scoring situations.

whatWentWrong.title: First-Quarter Fumble
whatWentWrong.description: Hurts' rare fumble on designed run in Q1 likely made OC Kellen Moore more conservative with QB rushing calls. Coming off bye week, offensive rhythm never developed.

whatWentWrong.title: Passing TD Doesn't Count
whatWentWrong.description: Hurts' 36-yard passing TD to Smith doesn't qualify for QB anytime TD props - only rushing TDs count. This distinction is crucial.

statisticalContext.vsSeasonAverage: 0 rushing TDs vs 0.56 per game average
statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: 0 rushing TDs vs 2 in last 3 games (66.7% rate)
statisticalContext.vsPropLine: Missed anytime TD prop at +100 odds
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Bottom 45% of Hurts' rushing TD performances

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was 70% variance, 30% analytical error. While Hurts' Tush Push success rate (94%) and 5 rushing TDs supported this prop, the 10-7 defensive slugfest created extreme variance. Philadelphia scoring only 10 total points (one via 36-yard passing TD) left zero goal-line opportunities for QB sneaks. However, the analytical error was betting QB TD in MNF game with O/U 45.5 that went under by 28.5 points. Should have weighted defensive game script risk more heavily.

closingLineValue.verdict: Positive CLV - line moved toward Hurts TD but defensive game destroyed prop.

keyTakeaways: QB anytime TD props require multiple offensive TDs - when team scores just 10 points (1 TD), no room for QB rushing score
Passing TDs don't count for QB anytime TD props - Hurts' Smith TD was irrelevant
36-yard passing TD was big play, not goal-line drive requiring Tush Push
First-quarter fumble likely reduced designed QB run calls
Defensive MNF games (0-0 halftime, 10-7 final) kill TD props across the board
verdict: Reasonable pre-game logic (Tush Push success, 5 rushing TDs, +100 odds) but extreme defensive variance destroyed prop. Eagles scoring only 10 points with one TD (36-yard pass) left zero goal-line opportunities for QB sneaks. First-quarter fumble reduced designed runs. Should have weighted risk of defensive slugfest more heavily in MNF primetime environment.
